page.title: 15CHANGING TIMES
page.content: {Shops.}In the 1930's the Allendale Co-operative Society had three parts, the main part which sold the food, the fruit shop which sold all of the fruit,and the drapery which sold clothes and kitchen equipment.The Post Office was built where Hutchinson's fruit shop is now,which is next to Allen house.There were two blacksmiths and there are none today.One was at the top of the Peth where Allendale Motor Company is now.There were two cake shops Dicks cake shop and a small cake shop.The Fish and Chip shop was behind Arnison Terrace at the back of what is now the Gift shop.The Butchers is in the same place and is still owned by the Co-op.The Chemist was in the same building but at the end nearest the Heatherlea Hotel.There was a cobblers but now you have to travel to Hexham to get your shoes repaired.
